result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Lomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid 90 days after release from Huber sentence, or penalty of 1 day jail, consecutive for non-payment.

With Huber. Sentence credit of 1 day was granted.
Concurrent with: Case 15CM1400
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Voss.

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Voss makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE:

20 DAYS HUBER  (1 day credit)  Defendant to report on 1/31/16 by 5:00 p.m.     *CONCURERNT WITH CASE #15CM1400* 

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted on this file and Case #15CM1400 and remainder due  90 days after release from huber, alternate 1 day jail if not paid)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.   Attorney Voss requests a sentencing date.  Court adjourns for sentencing.    Bail remains as fixed.

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Voss requests a jury status and jury trial date on case #15CM192.  This case to go in on jury status date on 15CM192.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court adjourns this case along with Defendant's other cases.  Attorney Thomas Voss has not been assinged to this case yet. Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Signed by Judge Carter on 06/19/15. Atty Thomas Voss has been appointed. Defendant to pay: $50/month commencing on 08/03/15.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers moves to withdraw as counsel due to Defendant not qualifying for public defender representation any more.  Court grants request.  Defendant states he will be requesting a court appointed attorney. Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
